data.title: Nice armosphere
data.text:
So, my second visit here was so much better than the first, I ordered Festive Fajitas, and had the Carne Asada. I also had the Cadillac Margarita.
This time the food was delicious and not served in a lot of oil. I would go back

data.title: Excellent downtown location.
data.text: Every time we have gone  to the Jalapeno Grill we have had a great meal. The steaks are fabulous. We took our of town family there and they were very impressed. Can get very noisy. We usually ask to be seated as far from the bar as possible.

data.title: Cruddy Food at Expensive Prices
data.text: To start, we were sat at a sticky table. I hate that. Then food was not good. The quality of ingredients seems poor to begin with, and then it isn't cooked well. No flavor, and greasy - I didn't even eat half of the Philly Cheesesteak I ordered (more like a stew meat french dip). And not one of my family members took their leftovers with them. It was not a meal we wanted to repeat. Total for 3 meals was $90.

data.title: Mediocre
data.text:
Ordered chicken fajita, the chicken was quite tough and without flavour. Requested sour cream on the side, but it came on top of everything. 
The chicken/ peppers/onions were served floating in hot grease.
Flour tortillas were small and one had a " dried out corner"
Not impressed enough to return.

data.title: mexican Restaurant with a Flair!
data.text:
I was staing in Excondido on business in Sna Diego and had asked my hotel desk person a good stak house with a bar. She recommended the Jalapeno Grill and Cantina.  I new it was going to be good becasue there were many locals there.

I sat at the bar becasue alone I get to alk to many people...all said it was a very good place. I was welcomed by the manager and bar tender and treated as a long lost cousin!  

First the Marguerite's, bar standard nothing special were very good and not the watered down kind at the tourist places in San Diego.  Serived was polite professional and very friendly.  

I ordered dinner of Steak and Shrimp. I seem to judge all meals by how they do vegetables.  These were steamed to perfection..crunchy but not raw, and well seasoned. They consisted of broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, fingerling potatoes and they were well seasoned. Very nice.  The shrimp was grilled and the top Sirloin was done just as I asked..medium rare and was very tender.

Service was very good and pleasant.  I enjoyed my time there and never did I feel rushed. The bar tender, and manager were very attentive.
 I liked it so much that I went back the following night and was not disappointed. 

The only thing preventing it from 5 stars is that it could use some painting inside and there was one character at the bar that had one too many drinks. He was loud...Someone should have said something to him.

data.title: " Outstanding "
data.text: I still have dreams about there Shrimp Tacos...My wife and I were on Vacation and stopped in for dinner....It was so good we went back the next nite for dinner again....The Food and Service were superb...They even offer outside Dining....Everything was so Good but don't miss the mexican shrimp cocktail Appetizer....Stop in for early dinner and enjoy happy hour drinks....Ray The Owner was a super nice guy and looks just like the most interesting man in the world...lol   He even gave me a free bottle of his all purpose seasoning to bring back to New Jersey.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Drinks were well made and the fried fish tacos were good.  Beware if sit outside because smoking is allowed.  Our server was very attentive even though he had lots of tables.

data.title: Love the food but service needs work
data.text: My wife decided to go here for her birthday dinner with our family. The food is of great taste. But it took 30 monutes to be served our main course and some elements were cold. When i asked why, i was told that they only have one cook. This is not a reason i can accept, the owner can cook too.. very upset.

data.title: Steak to die for
data.text: The venue is a cute place off the beaten path but close enough to downtown Escondido to walk to.  The food was terrific.  The beef was over the top good, incredibly tender and every mouthful a tingle to the senses.  I had the mahi mahi and the spices used were very good.  Service was excellent, cocktails perfectly prepared. I recommend and will be returning again and again.

data.title: Delightfully Surprised
data.text: Had company and wanted to go for Mexican food.  Thought we would try something new.  This is much more than Mexican.  They have great steaks and seafood as well.  The service was outstanding and food was delicious. This could easily become a regular stop.

data.title: Average At Best
data.text: A little disappointed with the quality of the food. The service was good however the food prep time was too long. Complimentary chips & salsa were served and there is a salsa bar with carrots, jalapenos and several different salsas.

data.title: It has become a habit
data.text: My friends and I meet for drinks and food every Tuesday evening.  The place we always go back to is the Jalapeño Grill in Escondido.  Good food, great service and no loud music to make us scream at each other.  We do occasionally try other places but always go back to the place we enjoy the most.  Prices are great also.

data.title: Average food, poor service
data.text:
We went there on a Saturday night,(6:00). My wife and i met an other cupple. The beer came qick along with the chips. We orderd in a reasonable time.
By 7:00 i staterd asking wheres the food? The server was curt and told us ther was a large group inside. So there a Management problem in stafing,. She left and we didn't see her for 15 minutes. She came with our frends food. We continued to wate. At 7:25. My fish toacs arrive. They were cold and The soft tortilla was gatting hard from being out so long.  Is was served on a wame to plate to hide the cold food,(an old trick). I sent the food back ane the waitress wanted to fight about it, insisting the food was fine. 
Our frends stake wasn't any beter than Dennys, and the service didn't make there experience any more appetizing.
When in Escondido skip Jalapeno Grill & Cantina. I sted try the Wooden spoon. Check my review of this place soon.

data.title: Best Margaritas!!
data.text: Excellent service, best mexican food in Escondido and the staff is friendly and very attentive. I give 2 thumbs up!!

data.title: Wednesday night dinner
data.text: We are in Escondido for a few days and the Steakhouse at Jalapeno Grill & Cantina was our place of choice for dinner on Wednesday evening.  We were impressed with the overall dining experience.  Our food was prepared just right.  I had the seared ahi salad and a shrimp cocktail.  Wife had a Cobb salad.  Ben our waiter was very attentive and we lacked for nothing.  Nice menu, many different Margaritas to choose from.  If you are in the area try it.  The steak menu looked impressive.

data.title: The very first "excellent" I give a restaurant
data.text:
We have been there before and it was very good so we went there again with friends (a local couple) and it was excellent. My wife had a salad w. chicken and I had the 16 oz prime rib. First I thought I'm not able to handle it, but I was - too good to return anything. My wife was unable to eat all, neither were our friends having the filet mignon and salmon. Both enjoyed it very much too. 
Summary: Excellent food, wonderful atmosphere - highly recommended.

data.title: Excellent food, nice atmosphere and personal service!
data.text: We go to the Jalapeno Grill on a regular basis - the prime rib is fantastic, the mexican dishes are excellent, and the fish dishes with mango topping are health and delicious.  The owner is very personable and we always feel very well taken care of.  They have such a nice variety of dishes that everyone can find something they like on the menu.  Our experience at this restaurant is very consistently excellent!

data.title: Excellent wood fired steak and Prime Rib
data.text: When I want a steak or prime rib in Escondido I go to Jalapenos. The owner used to be at the famous Fireside Inn where they were known for their prime rib.Reasonably priced compared to outback or black angus and much better. It is a smaller very quaint restaurant. The service is excellent. They even have a coupon in the buy one get one free book that is mailed out monthly here locally. If you enjoy eating outdoors they have patio seating also with heaters if it gets cool, which almost never happens here. It is a couple blocks away from the famous "cruising Grand" where vintage cars are displayed by there owners along many small privately owned restaurants.So if you are in escondido and craving a good steak or prime rib you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Surprise Delight!
data.text: We were looking for a quick bite before a conference and Jalapeño was serendipity.  Nice ambience and great service.  We sat outside as the sun was setting and, as the cold descended they turned on the heaters.  We enjoyed the prime-rib tacos and shrimp margarita.  Both were excellent . . . this was a superb taste of Escondido!

data.title: Great steak
data.text: We were here two days before Christmas, and the place was packed! We were first told there would be a 30 minute wait, but the owner (or manager) said to wait a few minutes, and cleared a place for us. Three in our group had been here before, and had their hearts set on salmon and prime rib, which, unfortunately, they ran out of. I had a great sirloin steak, the filet mignon was enjoyed. I'd like to go back and try the prime rib.
